results.title: New sounds in music
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Pieter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: Presents fascinating new sounds and new ways of treating old sounds. Chance music, tape music, synthesiser music, and other 20th century approaches are heard. Some newly invented string and percussion instruments are demonstrated and finally we go to the Mills College Tape Music Center for a presentation involving new instruments, musicians and “new” music.

results.title: New sound of music
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This BBC documentary narrated and presented by Michael Rodd demonstrates a sample of technology and technique musicians and sound recordists have used to come up with a “new sound in music”. The use of early oscillation and voltage control sound effects, computers, music synthesisers, multi-track-recording techniques, including tape manipulation are shown. Some early-automated musical instruments such as the Pianola and a programmed mechanical robotic violin are also seen. The presenter demonstrates how the electronic music theme to “Dr Who” was created in the BBC’s Radiophonic Workshop and other musical themes for television are shown in their creation. Archival footage showing a stage performance of an unattended computer that can make unique musical composition choices is included along with its inventor Peter Zinovieff (the founder of EMS: Electronic Music Studios) at home in his studio. Musician and inventor David Voorhaus demonstrates the “Maniac”, a unique analogue sequencer and an instrument that uses magnetic tape in the place of strings he created.

results.title: New romance
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind, ONF | NFB, Janet Walczewski and Susan Gabori
results.brief_description: Finely drawn study of the social aspects of heterosexual and homosexual relationships and asks whether people have a right to think, feel and act differently. Excellent use of locational interviews, cartoons and meaningful dialogue and opens up a subject that is often misunderstood.

results.title: New pulse of life - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: David Adams, Pyramid Films and Robert Berk
results.brief_description: Presents latest basic life support principles and techniques for cardiopulmonary resuscitation, as recommended by the National Research Council. Live subjects, mannequins, audio visual aids and animation are used to demonstrate A - Airway opened, B - Breathing restored and C - Circulation restored. Physiological background and dramatic CPR re-enactments are provided. The revised version does not contain a demonstration of the precordial thump or a witnessed cardiac arrest. The precordial thump should only be used in conjunction with an ECG monitoring machine.

results.title: New pulse of life
results.brief_description: Demonstrates procedures for restoring heartbeat and breathing in the first crucial minutes after a heart attack by re-enacting typical cases and showing correct methods of action. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: New paths to learning
results.creator_credit: Space Age Images and Litton Industries Broadcast
results.brief_description: The electronic age is revolutionising teaching. Oakland Community College in Michigan worked with Litton Industries to develop an automated system to enable a student to take their course at a time convenient to them. The College provides programmed instruction in a variety of subjects for people of all ages over a period of 14 hours each day. An automated cubicle in an audio-tutorial laboratory replaces the usual classroom.

results.title: New Orleans mardi gras
results.brief_description:
Some say the happiest day in New Orleans is Shrove Tuesday. And it is a day that stands for the entire carnival season with its Mardi Gras carnival parade. In this film the theme of the procession is “Toys” and every float is a variation on that theme. the people of the Algiers stage their parade on the broad waters of the Mississippi.
Completely planned, financed and executed with thirty or more secret organisations - a great deal of the activities are directed by tradition.
